brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate the use of autologous expanded mesenchymal stem cells
      intralesional transplantation as a safe and potentially beneficial treatment for patients
      with spinal cord injury.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Mesenchymal Stem Cells in Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  American Spinal Injury Association Impairment (ASIA) Scale A, B and C

          -  Cervical (under C4), thoracic o lumbar spine lesion

          -  Complete or Incomplete SCI

          -  Platelet count over 100.000/ul

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute SCI (less than 3 months)

          -  Active infectious diseases

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Neurodegenerative diseases

          -  Primary hematologic diseases

          -  Coagulopathies

          -  Hepatic dysfunction

          -  Pregnancy

intervention.description: Expanded Intralesional Autologous Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation

clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Mesenchymal Stem Cells in Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Patients

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of Autologous Expanded Mesenchymal Stem Cells transplantation in SCI patients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
